Case reference: 2016069642.CaseDesc: On April 21, 1995, the remains of a woman were discovered near Carbon, Alberta. The post-mortem interval is estimated to be between 10 and 15 years. The individual had dental restorations including stainless steel crowns.

Case reference: 2014005604.CaseDesc: On April 29, 2011, Dorothy Thomas was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Prior to being reported missing, Dorothy had not returned home for eighteen days.

Case reference: 2013000066.CaseDesc: Jean Corbeil was last seen on May 25, 1977 in Montreal, Quebec. Jean left his home in the De Lorimier district and was never seen or heard from since.

Sweater: Beige, with "USA Army" on the front

Case reference: 2012020165.CaseDesc: The remains of this male were found in a forested area immediately north of the Port Coquitlam cemetery.

Teeth: Visible Decay, Missing an upper front tooth on the left side prior to death. The upper front tooth on the right side was angled.
Deformity: Left Knee, Osgoode-Schlatter's disease - bony bump on shin below knee

Case reference: 2014004610.CaseDesc: On June 7, 1967, Absolom Halkett and his colleague, James Brady, were dropped off by plane at Foster Lake, SK, which is located 120 miles north west of La Ronge, SK. The two were prospecting in the area. They were last heard from on a radio call to a nearby mine on June 8th. Extensive land, air and water searches of the area failed to locate any trace of the two men. Their camp was located but had been unused.

Case reference: 2012020185.CaseDesc: Remains of this adult male were located on the shore of Lake Kamloops, approximately 19 kilometers west of Kamloops.

Teeth: False, Had no teeth. Only a lower denture was recovered which had dark brown stain, likely tobacco.
Pants: Other, Off-white, Canvas full length pants

Case reference: 2020001463.CaseDesc: On August 24, 2018, Sharon Gronfeldt was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2019032078.CaseDesc: On June 8, 2019, at aprroximately 2:19 pm, Shauranne Humphry was seen for the last time at the Anduhyaun Shelter in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014001004.CaseDesc: The remains of this unidentified male were found on Keats Island, near Gibsons, on May 3, 1992.

Case reference: 2022040012.CaseDesc: On August 10, 2022, Joseph Aldonia Chiasson was seen for the last time by his loved ones in the Shippagan region in New Brunswick. There have been unconfirmed reports he was seen in the Lamèque, NB area on August 12, 2022.

Deformity: Right Leg, Limps on Right leg

Case reference: 2014001057.CaseDesc: On October 10, 1989, the body of a man, possibly originating from Romania was discovered in a skylight of a condominium building. According to experts the man had bodily injuries resulting from a very high fall.

Socks: Wool, Beige, for left foot only
Pants: Wool, Brown, Black, size 30; made in Poland

Case reference: 2012020130.CaseDesc:
Mario Marabella, 40 years old, was on his way to a meeting when he was abducted on December 4, 2008 in Laval.  Mr. Marabella was at a service station on Highway 440 between Hwys. 19 and 25 around 4:00 p.m. when three people forced him into a van and fled. 

Mr. Marabella's car, a grey Acura MDX was retrieved around 8:00 p.m. that evening by one or more of the abductors at the same Petro-Canada station from which Mr. Marabella was abducted. A few hours later the car was found burning at the corner of Gouin Boulevard and Lambert St. in Montréal.  Mr. Marabella was known to be involved in organized crime.  He was linked to the Italian Mafia.

Scar: Abdomen, operation on abdomen for weight loss
Deformity: Abdomen, excess skin due to weigh lost

Case reference: 2017057938.CaseDesc: On April 23, 2016, this man jumped in front of a metro train at the Charlevoix station in Montreal, Quebec.

Case reference: 2016068714.CaseDesc: On June 26, 1967, the remains of a female were recovered from the Niagara River. Her post-mortem length was measured at 5’1”-5’2”, however, this measurement may not represent her actual living height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. Her appendix was present. The body is believed to have been in the water for some months to years prior to recovery.

Case reference: 2020011480.CaseDesc: On May 11, 1988, Amerk Barbarian was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Amerk had been seen by his landlord for the last time when his rent was collected.

Case reference: 2012020038.CaseDesc: Desiree Oldwoman was last seen near her home on the Siksika Fist Nations Reserve near Gleichen, Alberta. She is autistic and does not speak, although she can write her name. Ms. Oldwoman was last seen on August 27, 2011.

Case reference: 2013000112.CaseDesc: On March 14, 2012, a male was found in a densely wooded area to the north east of the junction of Winchester Road and Ritson Road, in Oshawa, Ontario. His appendix was present. It is believed he had been there from a few days to a few weeks.

Hair: Brown, Short, Shorter than collar length; few days growth of facial hair
Teeth: He had a full set of adult teeth with no restorations

Case reference: 2008006699.CaseDesc: On June 18, 1967, Stanley Sczcygiel was fishing on the Berens River with two other Americans.  All three were swept over the falls.  The other two men survived, however Mr. Sczcygiel is presumed to have drowned.  His body has never been recovered.

Case reference: 2014006282.CaseDesc: On November 26, 2012, a relative of Jean Marc Lavallée called the Roussillon Inter-municipal police to check on Mr. Lavallée at his residence in La Prairie, Québec, as they were worried about him. The police found that Mr. Lavallée was not at his residence, and his vehicle was not in the parking lot. The police took numerous steps to locate Mr. Lavallée, but he remains missing. He was seen for the last time on November 25, 2012.

Case reference: 2015020929.CaseDesc: On April 27, 2015, Andrzej Popek was last seen at the Crawford Lake Conservation Area in Milton, Ontario.  Andrzej's abandoned vehicle was located the following day in the Conservation's parking lot.

Case reference: 2005001099.CaseDesc: On April 22, 2004, an unidentified woman was discovered in a red 2004 Toyota Corolla under the Highway 400 Bridge on Highway 401 in Toronto, Ontario. Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts this female to be from the Americas, South Asia, or Mixed Americas.

Case reference: 2014002557.CaseDesc:
On April 17, 2000, Craig Snider left his family's place in Coquitlam to go to work as a commercial fisherman at Stevenson Marina in Richmond, British Columbia and has never been seen or heard from since. 
Mr Snider commuted regularly from Port Alberni, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2014004868.CaseDesc: On May 13, 2004, at approximately 8:00 a.m., Stephen Liou was seen for the last time as he left his home in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005883.CaseDesc: On December 7, 1996, André Pellerin was seen for the last time in the Nouveau-Rosemont district in Montreal, Quebec. He left his residence in the morning to go to a shopping mall. André suffers from mental health issues and must take his medication every day. When he left his home, he had no medication with him.

Coat: Nylon, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, Black, Three-quarter length

Case reference: 2014003913.CaseDesc: On May 4, 1973, Martin MAIER, 63 years old, was last seen leaving the Prelate, SK hotel at 1:00 a.m. Mr. MAIER was driving a 1971 Chevrolet half-ton, red with white half camper box, SK license F133013.  Extensive searches have been conducted, however neither Mr. MAIER or his vehicle have been located.

Sweater: Wool, Other, Siwash with a fish design

Case reference: 2014002878.CaseDesc: On February 26, 2001, Albert Fare was seen for the last time as he left his residence in Niagara Falls, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Albert was despondent.

Scar: Neck, Surgical; back of the neck

Case reference: 2006011199.CaseDesc: On May 9, 1986, Gregory Beaumont left the Silver Lake Campground by boat to fish on the lake. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2012020103.CaseDesc: Police are trying to identify a body retrieved from the sea just off the coast of l'Ile Miscou in New Brunswick by crab fishermen on May 3, 1980. The male was caucasian, with a muscular athletic build. His nose had been broken prior to his death. He also had a bridge with 6 gold and porcelain teeth in the top left side of his mouth and regular fillings in the bottom jaw.

Case reference: 2020010478.CaseDesc: On January 30, 1970, at approximately 3:30pm, Lois Perret was last seen by her boyfriend at her place of work in Toronto, Ontario. That day, Lois had quit her job and moved out of her apartment. During the time of her disappearance, Lois was three months pregnant and drove a 1964 black Valiant convertible.

Case reference: 2014001632.CaseDesc: Elizabeth Dorion was last seen by a friend at a local fishing camp on September 21, 1999. Ms. Dorion arrived at the fishing camp on the 17th of September with her friends and stayed there approximately 4 days. She was never seen again. Two separate ground searches were carried out. Several steep embankments as well as the area surrounding the camp were searched with negative results. Ms. Dorion's whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2014004874.CaseDesc: On December 12, 2006, Tracy Forde was seen for the last time at her home in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006022499.CaseDesc: Witold Sagin was last seen while fishing on Gordon Lake. He was fishing in a canoe, which was later found overturned. He is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2014002093.CaseDesc: Wilhemina (Winnie) Wanner went missing from her home on January 3rd, 1989 in Red Deer, Alberta.

Case reference: 2017014435.CaseDesc: On May 21, 2009, an unidentified man died of lung cancer in the Foothills Hospital in Calgary, Alberta. It was later discovered that this individual had presented false identification at the hospital and was buried under the same incorrect name. At the time of his death this man had a black mustache. There were no teeth present and this individual had upper and lower dentures.

Jewelry: Metal, White, EARRING, White metal with a clear stone
Tattoo: Right Hip, Naked woman intertwined with dragon down thigh

Case reference: 2017076047.CaseDesc: On July 1, 2017, an unidentified male body was located on the west bank of the North Saskatchewan River and approximately 300m south of the Dawson Bridge in Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014001016.CaseDesc: On June 14, 1983, the body of an unidentified man was found floating on the St-Lawrence river between L’ile Bouchard et St-Sulpice in Quebec. The man wore a partial upper denture and was missing three teeth.

Case reference: 2013000003.CaseDesc: On September 4, 2011, James "Jamie" Lee was camping with several friends at the Smoky Flats Campground. Jamie was last seen by friends during the early morning hours when he went for a walk by himself.

Case reference: 2014005643.CaseDesc: On October 21, 2008, it was reported a boat had capsized in Lake Winnipeg, 15 miles south east of Poplar River between Marchand Point and George Island. The boat left Poplar Point on Oct 20, 2008, to remove buoys from Lake Winnipeg. During the evening, the boat experienced technical difficulties and was unable to continue. Throughout the early morning hours the weather began to worsen, experiencing 10 foot waves, at this time the vessel started to take in water. As a result the boat began to sink. Two of the three passengers were able to make it to Marchand's Point where they were rescued. No foul play is suspected and it is presumed George Donald Everett drowned.

Jacket: Nylon, Black, zippered Bomber style with "Berens River" patch on back

Case reference: 2014005482.CaseDesc: Shaun Chris MacDonald-McLaughlin was reported missing on March 27, 2010 by his step-father. Shaun was last seen by his roommate on March 12, 2010, in Vancouver, British Columbia when he packed his belongings and stated he was going home. Shaun was known to have substance abuse problems and was diagnosed as a paranoid-schizophrenic.

Case reference: 2015011670.CaseDesc: On June 8, 1998, the body of a male was spotted by boaters on the St. Lawrence River, at St-Donat near Bellerive Park. According to the autopsy, the man may have made previous suicide attempts. He was found to be dressed in light clothing, suggesting his death may go back to the heat wave during the month of May 1998.

Socks: Grey, One sock on the right foot.
Bathing Suit: Nylon, Blue, Boxer type swim suit,  "Surf King Majestic" Brand, size XL
Scar: Abdomen, Vertical scar near the belly button.

Case reference: 2016065650.CaseDesc: On December 29, 2008, the skeletal remains of a male was recovered from the Lower Niagara River near the Maid of the Mist Docks below Niagara Falls. No clothing or personal effects were recovered. These remains may have been in the water for many years.

Case reference: 2006021099.CaseDesc: Roy Britten was last seen in a 14-foot aluminum boat in the Birch Beach area heading toward the northeast part of Caribou Island, Lake Superior, Ontario.  He is presumed drowned.

Jacket: Blue, Thunder Bay Police Force Association

Case reference: 2014004467.CaseDesc: On November 16, 1997, Sadhi, Samia, Samir, and Saeed Jiredeh were last seen as they left their home with their father in Toronto, Ontario. That day, their parents had gotten into an argument prior to them leaving.

Case reference: 2014004580.CaseDesc: On the morning of the 23rd of July 1991, a group of 8 individuals left Igloolik NU. heading to Hall Beach, NU.  The group travelled using a 24 feet freighter canoe powered by a 30 hp outboard.  It was a stormy day with heavy rain.  Approximately 15 miles North of Hall Beach, the canoe hit ice, filled with water and capsized.  Only one occupant made it back to shore.

Case reference: 2006012499.CaseDesc: On November 17, 1999, the skeletal remains of a male was found along the north bank of St. Mary's River in Bell's Point Park, Garden River First Nation, east of Sault Ste. Marie. It is estimated that he had been dead for at least three years or more.

Teeth: Several amalgam restorations in his lower teeth and evidence of tooth decay.

Case reference: 2020048673.CaseDesc: On September 27, 2020, Geoffrey Irwin was last seen on a Royal Bank of Canada surveillance camera in Langford, British Columbia and has not been seen since. On November 25th,2020, Geoffrey Irwin's black 2017 Ford Escape was located at Park Royal Mall in West Vancouver, British Columbia. Geoffrey is known to travel between the West Shore and the Lower Mainland.

Backpack: Nylon, Black, Grey, Black with grey stripes, with zipper
Shorts: Synthetic, Brown, Taupe or light brown colour with pockets, size large
Jacket: Cotton, Grey, Hooded with white drawstrings

Case reference: 2014004179.CaseDesc: On March 15, 1989, Leona Brule was seen for the last time in Fort Providence, Northwest Territories. During the time of her disappearance, Leona was leading a high-risk, and transient lifestyle. She may have spent sometime in Edmonton, Alberta and Florida, USA.

Teeth: Dental records indicate 7 teeth treated, 5 absent.

Case reference: 2014003051.CaseDesc: On May 11, 1991, Yannick Fortin, age 6, was last seen playing by himself in the backyard of the family residence in Matawin. The backyard of the house overlooks the St. Maurice River. Searches were conducted in the area but Yannick was never seen again.

Case reference: 2001008160.CaseDesc: Jesokah was last seen at approximately 21:30 hours as she was going to take a bus back to the village of Sooke.

Case reference: 2014004619.CaseDesc: William "Billy Jay" Sharphead was last seen leaving his residence on the Enoch Cree Nation in September of 2003.  On that night it is believed that he got into a car.  He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014003895.CaseDesc: On April 30, 1993, RCMP were advised Diana Thomas had fallen through the ice and had not surfaced. Diana was a passenger on a ski-doo along with her mother and a 13 year old driver. The threesome had only gone about 10 meters from shore when the back of the ski-doo went into the water, quickly followed by the front. Diana fell into the water with her mother and never resurfaced. Attempts were made to recover Diana, however all efforts met with negative results.

Case reference: 2022005006.CaseDesc: In February 2021, Deana Timms was last seen in London, Ontario. Deana’s family and friends have not heard from her since this time. It is out of character for her to not be in contact with her loved ones for such an extended time.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Visible missing lower teeth
Scar: Left Index Finger, On the ring finger

Case reference: 2014005330.CaseDesc: On September 13, 2009, at approximately 6:30 a.m., Rose Mackinnon was seen for the last time when she left the Earnestine Women’s shelter with her two children. Rose advised that she would be returning but has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014002711.CaseDesc: Sharel Haresym was reported missing September 6, 1984, he was last seen was on September 4, 1984. Mr. Haresym's vehicle was located parked on the entrance road to Twin Lakes campground near Winfield, Alberta. The vehicle was out of fuel and also had a dead battery. Mr. Haresym's clothing was located approximately 100 yards east of his vehicle. His clothing was laid out in a neat and orderly fashion with his bible alongside.

Case reference: 2013000071.CaseDesc: On July 5, 1993, Jean-Jacques Cantin was seen for the last time in the Ahuntsic district of Montreal, Quebec. His mother went to his apartment where she found packages that were prepared for different people. His personal belongings and clothes had disappeared.

Case reference: 2014005677.CaseDesc: On September 21, 2011, John Fadden was last seen in the University Endowment Lands, British Columbia.  He also suffered from dementia.

Case reference: 2014005093.CaseDesc: Hooshang Imanpoorsaid was last seen on May 2, 2008. At that time, he was living in Brossard. He was reported missing by his family. Mr. Imanpoorsaid’s credit card was used at Dorval airport and the Netherlands in 2008. He is of Iranian descent.

Case reference: 2014005513.CaseDesc: Jayson Nakas was reported missing on June 30, 1995 to the RCMP in Drayton Valley, Alberta. Mr. Nakas fell off an inner tube on the North Saskatchewan River. Mr. Nakas' friends saw him go under water but did not see him come back up.  His friends were the last ones to see him that day.

Case reference: 2016057640.CaseDesc: In the early hours of October 10, 2016, Terence Alook was last seen when he left a party at his aunt's home in the community of Desmarais, Alberta. Mr. Alook had been visiting his friends and family in the north end of Desmarais.

Other: Chin, Two moles on the lower chin

Case reference: 2012020116.CaseDesc: On April 1, 1975, Sylvie Ouimet left the Albert-Prevost institution, where she was hospitalized, without any of her personal effects. Her family has not heard from her since.

Scar: Ears, Surgical scar behind the ear

Case reference: 2005001199.CaseDesc: On May 3, 1975, the remains of a female were found in the Nation River near a bridge crossing Highway 417 in Casselman, Ontario. She has dyed reddish blonde hair that was naturally dark brown. Her finger and toe nails had red nail polish on them. She may have been a smoker. The cause of death was strangulation. A piece of television coaxial cable was found around her neck. A curtain rod runner (plastic wheel) was found in her left armpit. Her hands and feet were tied with men's neckties, one of which is called "The Canadian Tie". Her remains may have been in the water for some days to some months.

Teeth: Other, She has extensive dental work including both an upper and lower partial denture, as well as many fillings.
Other: Towel, red and white “J cloth" brand.
2 Throw cover, green with frills on ends, 70”x40”
Towels, White & red tea towel by FREIMAN'S LTD "Irish Toast"
Tie: Blue, Red, Maple leaf emblems, Bartolini Collection

Case reference: 2012020102.CaseDesc: Male human remains were found on May 5th 2003 in Sainte-Melanie of the Lanaudiere region. Surete du Quebec made a call out to an RCMP specialist who did a facial reconstruction based on the cranium found. The remains would be those of a black male, early 30's, medium build, between 1,57m and 1,72m who was shot several times in the head.

Case reference: 2017064837.CaseDesc: On November 2, 2017, at approximately 2:00 a.m., Mélissa Blais was seen for the last time in Louiseville, Quebec. Prior to her disappearance, Mélissa had driven to Louiseville’s downtown area in her 2011 black Toyota Corolla, license plate Quebec Y70 FAD, to spend the evening there. Her vehicle has never been found.

Tattoo: Left Shoulder, Heart and wings; letters "JO"

Case reference: 2006000899.CaseDesc: On November 5, 1990, a male was found at the Bloor-Yonge Subway Station in Toronto. His post-mortem length was estimated to be 5’10", however, due to traumatic injury, the estimated length may not be an accurate representation of his actual living height. His personal effects included a TTC Pass Card, a "Maxell" cassette tape.

Shirt: Blue, long-sleeve shirt with vertical stripes
Sweater: Black, White, horizontal stripe knit sweater
Jacket: black and grey pinstripe suit jacket
Scar: Left Hand, small scars on back of hand
Neck, fine scars on both sides of the neck

Case reference: 2020035043.CaseDesc: On August 17, 2020, Jacques Hébert was seen for the last time when he was preparing to go pick blueberries in the forest near his home in Berry, Quebec. Jacques has not been seen or heard from since.

Teeth: Upper denture and lower jaw prothesis with implants fixed to metal bar
Shoes: Rubber, Black, CROCS style, top cut, camouflage pattern, size 9
Pants: Synthetic, Dark Blue, Big Bill brand, work pants
Shirt: Synthetic, Dark Blue, Big Bill brand work shirt

Case reference: 2020007648.CaseDesc: James Oshanek was last seen at the end of August 1991 in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005227.CaseDesc: Carl Chenier was last seen in Montreal on February 23, 2009 by the superintendent of his apartment. It is believed that he may have mental health problems, but he was not on any medications. He often used the Montreal Metro.

Case reference: 2016061134.CaseDesc: On November 16, 1973, the remains of a male were recovered from Lakewood Beach, Lake Erie in Malden Township of Amherstburg. He was estimated to have been there for 1-3 years. His post-mortem length was recorded as being between 5’7"-5’8", however, this measurement may not represent his actual living height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.

Case reference: 2005005799.CaseDesc: October 8, 1978, the body of an unidentified man was found floating in Hamilton Bay near the Skyway Bridge. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 140-150 lbs and his length was measured at 5'4"-5'6", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He is thought to have been in the water for months to years.

Teeth: His upper right central incisor has a silicate/resin restoration.

Case reference: 2022012467.CaseDesc: On September 14, 1988, Paul Moore was seen for the last time as he left his residence in Lewiston, New York. His vehicle was subsequently found abandoned in a parking lot near the American Falls. During the time of his disappearance, Paul was despondent.

Case reference: 2021025959.CaseDesc: On March 1, 1988, a man fell from the Jacques-Cartier Bridge in Longueuil, Quebec. The man died a few hours later and was never identified. The images shown are facial approximation portraits of this unidentified man created by the Sûreté du Québec.

Hair: Brown, Auburn, Long, Wavy, Dark, fine, long and wavy
Socks: White, Red, White with red and navy blue stripes
Sweater: Cotton, Black, Short sleeved, "3310" brand, size small
Pants: Cotton, Blue, Elastics at waist, "Alpine" brand, size 30-76
Coat: Black, Short with cotton cuffs, "Paradise Express" brand
Scar: Chin, Scar on right side of chin, 1.5 cm

Case reference: 2019068654.CaseDesc: On November 16, 2019, Lara Parkin was seen for the last time in the South-West District of Montreal, Quebec. Lara is known to frequent Montreal’s downtown area and parks. She is also known to travel by foot or by public transit. During the time of her disappearance, Lara left her apartment without bringing any of her belongings.

Case reference: 2012020119.CaseDesc: On September 10, 1989, Francois Willey was seen for the last time in Chateauguay, Quebec. François has not been seen or heard from since.

Mark: Front Of Neck, Birthmark under Adam’s apple

Case reference: 2014006224.CaseDesc: In January 2013, Da Wang was seen for the last time by his fiancé in Buffalo, New York. However, the two continued to communicate through text messages for several months. On July 11, 2013, at approximately 7:18 p.m., Da’s fiancé received a final text message from him indicating that he was in trouble.

Case reference: 1996006630.CaseDesc: Adam, Mitchell and Trevor O'Brien may be in the company of their father.

Case reference: 2006013299.CaseDesc: Thomas Hesse was last seen on September 2, 1989 in Moonbeam Township, near Cochrane, Ontario.  He was riding a Raleigh, 3-speed, gold coloured, lady's bicycle.  Mr. Hesse left his parents' house in a depressed state and may have been suicidal.

Case reference: 2018063001.CaseDesc: On March 10, 1995, at around midnight, Ying Zhu was last seen by her boyfriend when he dropped her off at her home in Toronto, Ontario. The following day, her boyfriend arrived at Ying’s work to pick her up and found out that she had quit her job the previous week.

Case reference: 2014005682.CaseDesc: On September 27, 2011, Bernard Wierzba was seen for the last time as he swam with a friend near the Manola Bridge in Barrhead County, Alberta. During this time, Bernard was not wearing a life jacket and he has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2013000005.CaseDesc: On February 27, 2009, Jody Hockett was reported missing to the Grande Prairie RCMP. Jody had been partying at a friend's apartment on February 22, 2009. She left the party and was expected to return.  She was last seen getting into an older, white car in the downtown area of Grande Prairie sometime later that night, or the early morning hours of February 23, 2009. Jody was known to lead a high risk lifestyle.

Tattoo: Buttocks, Heart Symbol on left side

Case reference: 2014004972.CaseDesc: Asim Chaudhry was last seen leaving his residence on July 20, 2007 at 1400hrs to study for an upcoming exam at Simon Fraser University. Asim was despondent in the past.

Hair: Black, Brush Cut, Has a beard
Sweater: Cotton, Grey, Hooded with "Russel Athletic" in red and blue writing
Pants: Cotton, Grey, Sweat Pant, Sweat pants

Case reference: 2016061103.CaseDesc: On May 23, 2003, a male was found in the Detroit River, near the Livingston Channel in Amherstburg. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 150 lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He may have been a heavy coffee drinker or smoker. His appendix was present. Biogeographic Ancestry testing predicts this unidentified male is of European ancestry.

Hair: Black, Brown, Straight, Greying moustache and beard
Teeth: Upper denture and a lower partial plate
Other: Detroit area bus pass dated November 2002
Jacket: Dark Green, Orange, Bomber style, knitted waist and cuffs, orange lining

Case reference: 2014003491.CaseDesc: On June 12th, 1981, Gordon Westover was seen at a local beer garden in Fort St John, BC at approximately 11:00 PM. Mr. Westover left the gathering in an unknown direction and has not been seen or heard from since. Mr. Westover has a mild mental disability and has been known to impersonate professional people such as police, firefighters, military and doctors. Mr. Westover told several people at the party that he was going to join the military, but no records show Mr. Westover was ever recruited. Mr. Westover has not been seen or heard from.

Case reference: 2014001584.CaseDesc: Alexander Petritsis was last seen June 30, 1994, in Montreal. He left his residence with his car, without saying where he was going to anyone. On that day, Alexander did not go to work.

Case reference: 2008006299.CaseDesc: On September 30, 1960, Willie Ray was reported missing. He had left his residence approximately 3 weeks earlier. It was common for him to go hunting and fishing.  Mr. Ray was reportedly very comfortable living in the outdoors and could sustain himself for quite sometime. There was a 12 gauge shotgun missing from the Ray residence. The boats frequently used by Mr. Ray were all accounted for.

Case reference: 2015011649.CaseDesc: On September 17, 1999, a black man died in a fatal road accident in Montreal in the Ahuntsic district. This person would have been approximately 25 years old.

Pants: Blue, White, "Puma" written on the left thigh
Coat: Blue, White, plaid with a gray hood

Case reference: 2012020662.CaseDesc: Marc April was last seen at approximately 6:30 p.m. on the January 31, 1987, at the Saskatoon City Hospital. Mr. April was a patient at a hospital at the time of his disappearance.

Case reference: 2014005268.CaseDesc: On May 26, 2009, Harold Dorion was reported missing to the Nelson House RCMP. Investigation later identified that Mr. Dorion was last seen the last week of July 2007. Since that time, Mr. Dorion has not been seen or heard of. His whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2014005606.CaseDesc: Larry Duck of Tadoule Lake was last seen in April of 2011, in Winnipeg, Manitoba. Larry has not made contact with his family since. His whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2014003304.CaseDesc: Milde was last seen in 1993 where his vehicle was abandoned near the City of Lethbridge Landfill. Footprints in the snow were seen leading from the vehicle into the coulees and disappeared.

Case reference: 2018062675.CaseDesc: On November 3, 2018, Aaron Normandeau was seen for the last time by a friend on the Ottawa River in an aluminum boat. The boat capsized and Aaron went under the water and did not resurface.

Case reference: 2014002244.CaseDesc: On August 11, 2000, Giuseppe Ciancio was seen for the last time at the Beaches Pub in the Saint-Laurent District of Montreal, Quebec. On that evening, Giuseppe left the bar with a friend in a beige Dodge Caravan. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2008000499.CaseDesc: Kimberley Ann Amero was last seen at her residence in Saint John, New Brunswick on September 3, 1985. There has been no contact with family or friends since.

Case reference: 2015045751.CaseDesc: On August 26, 2015 Lester Sampson was reported missing from Glen Vowell First Nation Village in B.C. This community is located on the west side of the Skeena River between Hazelton and Kispiox. Mr. Sampson’s brother last saw him at his residence in Glen Vowell on August 25, 2015.

Case reference: 2014004864.CaseDesc: On November 6, 2006, at approximately 9:00 a.m., Ahmed Moalin-Mohamed was seen for the last time as he left his apartment to search for employment in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004628.CaseDesc: On April 18, 2005, Patrick Marshall was last seen when he left his residence in the North East area of Jean Cote, Alberta. Patrick had left a note indicating that he would be travelling to Calgary with a friend. The note also indicated that he would be in contact within a few weeks. When he left, Patrick left with minimal clothes and toiletries.

Hair: Brown, Short, Dark brown, turning grey

Case reference: 2014003874.CaseDesc: Marthe Turcotte was last seen in Montreal on September 13, 1971. Her sister dropped her off at the Jean-Talon metro station but she was never seen again. Marthe was a student in Nursing at Thetford CEGEP in Thetford Mines.

Case reference: 2014005728.CaseDesc: On December 12, 2011, James Mayer was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. James had last spoken with his mother on December 14.

Case reference: 2014001228.CaseDesc: On June 6, 2004, the remains of a man were recovered from the North Saskatchewan River in Edmonton, Alberta.  There was dental work present.

Case reference: 2014003816.CaseDesc: On September 23, 1992, Stéphane Murray left his residence in the Beauport area to attend an appointment. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Tattoo: Right Arm, Death's head and a bat
